author: Raymond Colitt
description: Brazil’s unpopular President Michel Temer has held on to office for over a year after the impeachment of his predecessor, backed mostly by Congress and financial markets. Under the weight of new corruption allegations against him, that support is crumbling.
title: Pressure Mounts on Brazil's Temer as Pillars of Support Erode

author: Reuters Editorial
description: Demonstrators gathered across Brazil on Sunday to call for the resignation or ouster of President Michel Temer who is implicated in a widening corruption scandal that is undermining his government's fragile efforts to end a historic recession.
title: Protesters call for Temer resignation as uncertainty grips Brazil

author: Jonathan Watts
description: Tadeu Filippelli, a former vice-governor of the capital and cabinet adviser, was among three senior politicians detained in Brazil’s latest corruption scandal
title: Brazil police arrest close aide of president in World Cup scheme

author: Gabriel Shinohara, Rachel Gamarski
description: Violent protests rocked Brazil’s capital on Wednesday as President Michel Temer sought to suppress a revolt within his own party after last week’s damaging graft allegations.
title: Ministry Torched as Brazil's Temer Faces Violence, Party Mutiny

author: Silvia Amaro
description: The latest political scandal to hit Brazil is likely to put an end to President Michel Temer's term before the end of 2018, an analyst told CNBC on Monday.
title: There’s 100% chance that Brazil’s President Michel Temer will leave before end of mandate: Analyst

author: SARAH DiLORENZO
description: SAO PAULO (AP) — Brazil is home to the largest rainforest on Earth. It has miles of sandy, deserted beaches, and stunning flat-topped mountains. It invented samba and a devilish little drink called the caipirinha. It has massive reserves for native peoples and charming colonial towns built by the Portuguese. Despite the seeming abundance of riches for travelers, it has a tourism problem. Because while you may have heard about the Amazon or the stunning beaches of Rio de Janeiro, you have probably also heard that Brazil has high crime, was swept by a Zika outbreak and that its politicians have concocted the largest graft scheme in Latin American history.
title: Brazil packed with travel riches, so why so few tourists?

author: Bruce Douglas, Raymond Colitt
description: Brazil plunged back into crisis when the Supreme Court authorized an investigation into President Michel Temer on accusations of passive corruption and obstruction of justice. The allegations are the latest development in Operation Carwash, a sprawling corruption probe that has implicated many of the country’s business and political elite and helped bring down Temer’s predecessor, Dilma Rousseff. Temer has repeatedly denied the allegations, but several opposition legislators have called for impe
title: How Brazil's New Political Crisis Might Play Out: QuickTake Q&A

author:
Aaron West                    

                                    
                        @ayyy_west
description: The Flamengo youngster will stay in Brazil until he turns 18.
title: Real Madrid will sign 16-year-old Brazilian wonderkid Vinicius Junior for reported €45 million | FOX Sports

author: Pedro Nicolaci da Costa
description: Like Donald Trump, Brazil's president is facing a seemingly intractable political crisis — with huge economic implications.
title: There's another American economy facing talk of presidential impeachment

author: Silvio Cascione
description: Brazilian President Michel Temer, facing growing calls for his resignation amid a corruption scandal, will not step down even if he is formally indicted by the Supreme Court, he said in an interview in Folha de S. Paulo, Brazil's largest newspaper, on Monday.
title: Brazilian President Temer: 'I won't resign. Oust me if you want'
